options.label: C

title: The impostor syndrome

options.label: C
options.text: A hugely unhelpful picture of what other people are really like.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.text: We know both ourselves and others from the outside.

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: We become more critical of others.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the ultimate goal of overcoming the Impostor Syndrome?

options.label: B
options.text: To become more confident and self-assured.

options.label: C
options.text: To take on more responsibility and pursue one's goals.

options.label: D
options.text: To feel more connected to and at peace with oneself.

title: Why can't you divide by zero?

multiple-choice.question: What is the problem with dividing by zero in mathematics?

options.label: A
options.text: It results in an infinitely large answer.

options.label: B
options.text: It is not possible to find a multiplicative inverse of zero.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes all numbers to become equal to zero.

options.label: D
options.text: It is not a basic operation in mathematics.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: A number that, when multiplied by the original number, results in one.

options.label: C
options.text: A number that, when divided by the original number, results in zero.

options.label: D
options.text: A number that, when multiplied by the original number, results in infinity.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Because it would not be a useful definition in mathematics.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it would not be a valid mathematical operation.

options.label: A

options.label: A

title: You won't believe your eyes

multiple-choice.question: What is the main topic of the video "Smarter Every Day"?

options.label: A
options.text: The structure of the human eye

options.label: B
options.text: The persistence of vision and how our brain processes visual information

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the device created by Greg that is featured in the video?

options.label: D
options.text: The device is not given a specific name in the video

multiple-choice.question: How does the device created by Greg work?

options.label: A
options.text: It uses a series of LEDs to create a static image

options.label: B
options.text: It uses a series of LEDs mounted on a DC motor to create a moving image

options.label: C
options.text: It uses a projector to display images

options.label: D
options.text: It uses a combination of LEDs and mirrors to create a 3D image

options.label: D
options.text: The delay time is not specified in the video

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of the persistence of vision on our perception of a moving image?

options.label: C
options.text: It creates a smooth and continuous image

options.label: D
options.text: It has no effect on our perception of a moving image

multiple-choice.question: Why do we not see a gap in the image created by Greg's device?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the LEDs are mounted close together

options.label: B
options.text: Because the device is rotating at a high speed

options.label: C
options.text: Because of the persistence of vision

options.label: D
options.text: Because of the high frame rate of the camera

multiple-choice.question: What is the minimum frame rate required to create a smooth and continuous image?

options.label: D
options.text: The minimum frame rate is not specified in the video

multiple-choice.question: According to Dr. Stuart Anstis, what is the trade-off that the eye has to make in terms of time resolution and sensitivity to light?

options.label: A
options.text: The eye has to trade off time resolution for sensitivity to light

options.label: B
options.text: The eye has to trade off sensitivity to light for time resolution

options.label: C
options.text: The eye has to balance time resolution and sensitivity to light

options.label: D
options.text: The eye does not have to make a trade-off between time resolution and sensitivity to light

options.label: D
options.text: The term is not specified in the video

title: Why are fish fish-shaped? - Lauren Sallan

title: The surprising reasons animals play dead - Tierney Thys

options.label: C

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: To develop new techniques for animal training

options.label: C
options.text: To improve our understanding of human responses to violence

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: Stay in - or leave - a relationship?

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the most consequential and painful decisions people have to make in their lives?

options.label: A
options.text: Whether to pursue a new career or stay in their current job.

options.label: B
options.text: Whether to stay in a relationship or leave it.

options.label: C
options.text: Whether to have children or not.

options.label: D
options.text: Whether to move to a new city or stay in their current location.

multiple-choice.question: What is one factor that can influence a person's decision to stay in a relationship or leave it?

options.label: A
options.text: The state of their friends' relationships.

options.label: B
options.text: The degree of noise surrounding new sexually driven dating apps.

multiple-choice.question: Historically, what were some of the external sanctions that made it more difficult for people to leave a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: Religions that insisted God blessed unions, societal disapproval, and psychologists who warned of the negative impact on children.

options.label: B
options.text: Financial constraints, lack of education, and limited job opportunities.

options.label: C
options.text: Family pressure, cultural expectations, and personal guilt.

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what do psychologists now routinely tell us about children and parental relationships?

options.label: A
options.text: That children are deeply and permanently scarred by any termination in their parents' relationship.

options.label: B
options.text: That children would prefer a broken family to an unhappy one.

options.label: C
options.text: That children are not affected by their parents' relationship.

options.label: D
options.text: That children are better off with a single parent.

multiple-choice.question: What is the burden of choice that falls squarely on individuals when deciding whether to stay in a relationship or leave it?

options.label: A
options.text: The opinions of their friends and family.

options.label: B
options.text: The expectations of society and culture.

multiple-choice.question: What is suggested as a helpful tool for individuals trying to make a decision about their relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: A set of questions to fall back upon, like a checklist.

multiple-choice.question: What is one question that individuals might ask themselves when evaluating their relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: How much of their unhappiness can be attributed to their partner?

options.label: B
options.text: How much of their happiness can be attributed to their partner?

options.label: C
options.text: How much of their unhappiness is due to external factors?

options.label: D
options.text: How much of their happiness is due to external factors?

multiple-choice.question: What is another question that individuals might ask themselves when evaluating their relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: What are the annoying traits in their current partner that they don't have?

options.label: B
options.text: What are the annoying traits in all previous partners that their current partner happens not to have?

options.label: C
options.text: What are the positive qualities in their current partner that they appreciate?

options.label: D
options.text: What are the negative qualities in their current partner that they dislike?

multiple-choice.question: What is one thing that individuals might consider when evaluating their feelings about their relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: How they would feel if they were single again.

options.label: B
options.text: How they would feel if they were in a new relationship.

options.label: C
options.text: How they felt as a child.

options.label: D
options.text: How they would feel if they had to start over.

multiple-choice.question: What is the final advice given to individuals who are considering leaving their relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: To stay in the relationship and work through their issues.

options.label: B
options.text: To leave the relationship and start fresh.

options.label: C
options.text: To take a break from the relationship and re-evaluate their feelings.

options.label: D
options.text: To leave the relationship, but only if they have thought it through carefully and are prepared for the potential consequences.

title: The difference between the United Kingdom, Great Britain and England explained

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between the United Kingdom and Great Britain?

options.label: A
options.text: The United Kingdom includes Northern Ireland, while Great Britain does not.

options.label: B
options.text: The United Kingdom is a geographical term, while Great Britain is a political term.

options.label: C
options.text: The United Kingdom is a single country, while Great Britain is a country of countries.

options.label: D
options.text: The United Kingdom is a sovereign nation, while Great Britain is not.

multiple-choice.question: What are the four co-equal and sovereign nations within the United Kingdom?

options.label: B
options.text: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland

options.label: C
options.text: England, Scotland, Ireland, and the Isle of Man

options.label: D
options.text: England, Wales, Northern Ireland, and the Republic of Ireland

multiple-choice.question: What is the full name of the United Kingdom?

options.label: A
options.text: The United Kingdom of England, Scotland, and Wales

options.label: B
options.text: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland

options.label: C
options.text: The United Kingdom of the British Isles

options.label: D
options.text: The United Kingdom of England, Scotland, Wales, and Ireland

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between the terms "British" and "English"?

options.label: A
options.text: "British" refers to the United Kingdom as a whole, while "English" refers specifically to England.

options.label: B
options.text: "British" refers specifically to England, while "English" refers to the United Kingdom as a whole.

options.label: D
options.text: "British" refers to the British Isles, while "English" refers to the English language.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Crown, and what is its role in the United Kingdom?

options.label: A
options.text: The Crown is a physical object that symbolizes the monarchy, and it has no real power.

options.label: B
options.text: The Crown is a legal entity that represents the monarchy, and it has significant power in the United Kingdom.

options.label: C
options.text: The Crown is a corporation that owns the United Kingdom, and it is controlled by the monarch.

options.label: D
options.text: The Crown is a historical relic with no modern significance.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Commonwealth Realm, and which countries are part of it?

options.label: A
options.text: The Commonwealth Realm is a group of countries that were formerly part of the British Empire and still recognize the Crown.

options.label: B
options.text: The Commonwealth Realm is a group of countries that are currently part of the British Empire.

options.label: C
options.text: The Commonwealth Realm is a group of countries that have never been part of the British Empire.

options.label: D
options.text: The Commonwealth Realm is a group of countries that are part of the European Union.

multiple-choice.question: What is the difference between the Crown Dependencies and the British Overseas Territories?

options.label: A
options.text: The Crown Dependencies are independent nations, while the British Overseas Territories are not.

options.label: B
options.text: The Crown Dependencies are not independent nations, while the British Overseas Territories are.

options.label: C
options.text: The Crown Dependencies are part of the United Kingdom, while the British Overseas Territories are not.

options.label: D
options.text: The Crown Dependencies are not part of the United Kingdom, while the British Overseas Territories are.

multiple-choice.question: What is the status of Gibraltar and the Falkland Islands?

options.label: B
options.text: They are both part of the United Kingdom.

options.label: D
options.text: They are both British Overseas Territories.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland?

options.label: A
options.text: The Republic of Ireland is part of the United Kingdom.

options.label: B
options.text: The Republic of Ireland is an independent nation that was formerly part of the United Kingdom.

options.label: C
options.text: The Republic of Ireland is a Crown Dependency.

options.label: D
options.text: The Republic of Ireland is a British Overseas Territory.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of the monarch in the United Kingdom?

options.label: A
options.text: The monarch has absolute power and control over the government.

options.label: B
options.text: The monarch has significant power and influence over the government.

options.label: C
options.text: The monarch has ceremonial and symbolic duties, but no real power.

options.label: D
options.text: The monarch has no role in the government.

title: A simple way to tell insects apart - Anika Hazra

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary purpose of examining an insect's mouthparts in scientific classification?

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the seven levels of scientific classification?

multiple-choice.question: Why may mouthpart identification not always be accurate?

options.label: B
options.text: Because some insects have different mouthparts at different stages of development

options.label: C
options.text: Because some insects have evolved to have no mouthparts

options.label: D
options.text: Because some insects have mouthparts that are not yet discovered
